Issues.Title: Synk Vulnerability SNYK-JS-Y18N-1021887 transitively in @angular/localize
Issues.Body:
üõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõë

Please read https://angular.io/guide/security#report-issues on how to disclose security related issues.

üõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõë

Issue is not directly in angular code, so creating issue as opposed to following the link above.

***Problem:*** @angular/localize [v10.2.3](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/10.2.3/packages/localize/package.json#L33) and [v9.1.12](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9.1.12/packages/localize/package.json#L37) both use [yargs@15.13.0](https://github.com/yargs/yargs/blob/v15.3.0/package.json#L31), which in turn uses y18n@^4.0.0.  y18n has the following Prototype Pollution [synk vulnerability](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-Y18N-1021887), with a remediation of upgrading y18n to v5..0.5 or higher.

[yargs@16.1.1](https://github.com/yargs/yargs/blob/v16.1.1/package.json#L52) upgrades to y18n@^5.0.5.  Is it possible to update the 9.x and 10.x lines of @angular/localize to use this higher version of yargs?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Synk Vulnerability SNYK-JS-Y18N-1021887 transitively in @angular/localize" (#39743)

Issues.Title: build: update to latest "yargs" package
Issues.Body:
The 15.x versions of `yargs` relied upon a version of `y18n` that
has a SNYK vulnerability.
This commit updates the overall project, and therefore also the
`localize` and `compiler-cli` packages to use the latest version
of `yargs` that does not depend upon the vulnerable `y18n`
version.
The AIO project was already on the latest `yargs` version and so
does not need upgrading.

Fixes #39743
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update to latest "yargs" package" (#39749)

Issues.Title: docs: fix confusing description for strictTemplates
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes a confusing description of the `strictTemplates` flag.

> When `true`, enables strict template type checking in Angular version 9.

This seems to imply that the flag is only available in one version.
Strict template type checking is available in version 9 **and above**.

Issues.Title: feat(language-service): watch extended configs for option changes
Issues.Body:
Currently the language service watches only the root config file of a
configured project for changes. Of course, for correctness, we should
watch for changes in any relevant config file.

This commit attaches file watchers to the project root config file, and
all known extended config files as determined by `readConfiguration`.
On a change to any config file, refresh the compiler options known by
the Angular LS, and attach file watchers for any newly-extended config
files.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(language-service): watch extended configs for option changes" (#39741)

**Anything else relevant?** ### My Context - I need to use "jsonp" requests pattern to load all the API swagger.json of my enterprise to build a catalog so i need a way to bypass CORS. - I turn on fidller and i can stated that on a jsonp request the swagger.json is correctly loaded: **HTTP 200**. ### My Homework I spent some time to read **@angular/common/http/src/jsonp.ts** and there is still something that doesn't match my understanding: On a Jsonp Query you got a **JsonpInterceptor** that initiate a **JsonpClientBackend** having - a *callbackMap* property of type **JsonCallbackContext**. - a *resolvedPromise* **microtask** . This interceptor launch the call by invoking **JsonpClientBackend**.*handle(req: **HttpRequest**): **Observable**>*. - this method setup the **JsonpClientBackend**.*resolvedPromise* **microtask** by setting > - a HTML **script** tag, > - a callback on the here above **JsonpClientBackend**.*callbackMap*, > - the **onLoad** event of the **script** tag that itself set up: > - the **microtask** by implementing **resolvedPromise**.*then*. To complete the **microtask** implemented on **resolvedPromise**.*then* you need a *finished* flag to be set at *true*. - This *finished* flag is set to *true* by the callback spare on private **JsonpClientBackend**.*callbackMap*. My 2 cents ‚úçÔ∏è: I DID'NT FIND ANY CODE THAT TRIGGER THE **JsonpClientBackend**.*callbackMap*: something like 
this.callbackMap[callback]( body )
Maybe i'm wrong but be sure that before i wrote this post i check and check and chek again... That is the only reason i found to explain why despite my resource is loaded I always get *JSONP injected script did not invoke callback.*

Issues.Title: docs: Misleading route matching strategy documentation
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

The documentation for `pathMatch` makes it sound like the router will look for the first route that matches a URL, while in practice it is a depth-first search, e.g.:

```ts
const routes: Routes = [{
  path: 'a',
  component: A
}, {
  path: 'a/:id',
  component: B
}];
```

In the configuration above, the path `a/15` will match the second path (which is a good thing).

However the documentation mentions:

```
the router checks URL elements from the left to see if the URL matches a given path, and stops when there is a match
```

Which could be understood as "it checks the routes one by one and stops as soon as it finds a match", and with the configuration above that would mean the first route (as it's a prefix and not a full path match strategy).

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/api/router/Route#pathMatch
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs: Misleading route matching strategy documentation" (#39737)

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report


Examples

 - _I want to start using Angular and want to create a new application. Hence I want to find out more about `ng new` find out about `ng new` because I saw this command in https://angular.io/guide/setup-local._
   - Click on Reference
   - Click on CLI Command Reference
   - `ng new`

- _I want to learn about Differential loading_
   - Click Best Practices
   - Click On Dev Workflow
   - Deploying Applications
   - From the right navigation find Differential Loading

- _I want to learn how to turn on vendor sourcemaps_
   - Click on Reference
   - Click on Conceptual Reference
   - Click Workspace and project structure
   - Workspace configuration
   - From the right navigation find Optimization and source map configuration


At the moment it requires a lot of "clicks" to navigate to an important documentation piece and sometimes the namings of the sections are confusing and hard to follow. As I user I wouldn't think to find Optimization and source map configuration under Conceptual Reference.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs: make docs more discoverable and reduce clicks" (#39736)

Issues.Title: Forms: better handling of internal `onCollectionChange` callbacks
Issues.Body:
Form controls have internal API that allows subscribing to changes in a data collection of `FormGroup`s and `FormArray`s (when a new control is added to a collection or existing one is removed). This internal API is used inside `FormGroupDirective` to trigger DOM updates. The problem with the current API is that there is no way to append a callback or remove a particular one (for ex. a callback that belongs to a directive that is being removed). Instead, new `onCollectionChange` callback always resets existing one.

We should consider updating the logic that handles `onCollectionChange` callback to provide an ability to add and remove
particular callbacks without affecting previous callbacks, similar to what we have for `onChange` callbacks. That should help implement more granular management of the `onCollectionChange` callbacks.

Note: this change would be backwards-incompatible since some exiting code may rely on the fact that the `onCollectionChange` callback is getting rewritten. There is a PR #39685 that implements the change proposed in this ticket.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Forms: better handling of internal `onCollectionChange` callbacks" (#39732)

Issues.Title: fix(router): correctly handle string command in outlets
Issues.Body:
There are many places where examples use just a string for the command
in outlets. When using nested outlets, we do not correctly handle
this case, as the types and algorithm always expect an array.
This PR updates the `createUrlTree` algorithm to account for the
possibility of a string literal as the command for an outlet.

Fixes #18928

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
This feature request is for @angular/common


### Description
My suggestion is to support jest as default testing framework. Currently it's possible to use jest but it requires additional setup and an external dependency called `jest-preset-angular` to get not overwhelmed with configuration stuff. In my eyes jest brings some serious advantages over Karma.

- Parallel test execution
- Rerun only affected tests 
- Headless by default
- Well documented


### Describe the solution you'd like
Jest support without additional configuration setup. A possible solution could be a parameter on the `ng new` command which let the user decide the testing framework.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Setup custom testing configuration for each project and use the external package `jest-preset-angular`

I've searched for similar issues here on GitHub but found nothing about this topic. Maybe we can discuss here if such a feature is useful or not. Is there anything I'm missing why there is no default support yet?

Issues.Title: Give me the option to update an existing xlf file
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

- [X] extract-i18n

### Description
I'm a bilingual developer and always need to translate my apps.  Whenever I make any small change, I have to re-translate the whole xlf file. I do not use any translation services, I can speak both languages very well. I also do not see why I have to pay hundreds of dollars to use a translation app just so it can take an old xlf file and use the ID of it to update the fresh one produced each time by the angular cli.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Give me the option to update an existing xlf file. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

- I've read on a close thread it would look weird to have translation in an xlf file produced by angular cli. This sounds more dogma than technical limitation. You can always give the option to do both.
- martinroob/ngx-i18nsupport

See: https://github.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/377#issuecomment-241258405

Closes #10411

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR when using HTTPS reverse proxy
Issues.Body:
With this change we set the publicHost to `0.0.0.0:0`, when it's not provided.

This solved issues where previously the publicHost needed to be specified directly to get around `ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR` error when proxing https -> http.

NB: this was also the behaviour in version 10 https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/c252968225c0ecac6c4d8ee08e14ae64de8791a8/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/dev-server/index.ts#L170

Closes #19403
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR when using HTTPS reverse proxy" (#19412)

Issues.Title: angular 11 throws net::ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/cli or @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 10.2.3 Console output in Angular 11: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1266245/99274343-86309380-282a-11eb-9d15-adf67b940a8b.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1266245/99274507-b6783200-282a-11eb-8fbb-2accbe6d39d2.png) ### Description It was working in Angular 10. Console output: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1266245/99273194-f9d1a100-2828-11eb-94e5-d260f4160c93.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1266245/99273273-15d54280-2829-11eb-9bf3-568566e5ca6a.png) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Clone https://github.com/snebjorn/dotnet-angular11 1. Run `ng serve` in ClientApp folder 2. Run `dotnet run` in the root folder 3. Open the browser at https://localhost:5001/ 4. Observe the errors ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.0.1
Node: 12.16.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 11.0.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1001.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1100.1
@angular-devkit/core            10.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.0.1
@angular/cli                    11.0.1
@schematics/angular             11.0.1
@schematics/update              0.1100.1
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.5
**Anything else relevant?** The frontend is accessed via https://localhost:5001 because it's "hosted" with ASP.NET Core using `spa.UseProxyToSpaDevelopmentServer("http://localhost:4200");`. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/client-side/spa/angular?view=aspnetcore-5.0&tabs=visual-studio The self-signed localhost certificate is trusted. `dotnet dev-certs https -t`. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/security/enforcing-ssl?view=aspnetcore-5.0&tabs=visual-studio#trust-the-aspnet-core-https-development-certificate-on-windows-and-macos

Issues.Title: The "@angular-devkit/schematics" package cannot be resolved from the workspace root directory
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by a missing package @angular-devkit/schematics when doing ng update ### Is this a regression? I don't know ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è ### Description When doing ng update from angular 10 to 11 this error is displayed: > The "@angular-devkit/schematics" package cannot be resolved from the workspace root directory. This may be due to an unsupported node modules structure. > Please remove both the "node_modules" directory and the package lock file; and then reinstall. > If this does not correct the problem, please temporarily install the "@angular-devkit/schematics" package within the workspace. It can be removed once the update is complete. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Start a new project (from angular 10.1.2 in this example) `ng new` try to update it `ng update` The error ## üî• Exception or Error 

The "@angular-devkit/schematics" package cannot be resolved from the workspace root directory. This may be due to an unsupported node modules structure.

Issues.Title: Angular 11: @ngtools/webpack : forkTypeChecker intermittently behaves as though directTemplateLoading is true
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Is this a regression?
It became worse in Angular 11 / @ngtools/webpack 11.

### Description

I use pug for my angular templates:
```ts
@Component({
  selector: 'app-page',
  templateUrl: './app-page.component.pug',
  styleUrls: ['./app-page.component.scss'],
  animations: [
```
As I understand `@ngtools/webpack` rewrites it to `templateUrl: require('./app-page.component.pug')` and it uses my configured loaders.

Anyway, the problem is that when I build my codebase with `webpack-dev-server` it intermittently behaves as though it doesn't recognize my loaders when validating types. It only affects type checking as the code works perfectly. This is the output:

```
‚Ñπ ÔΩ¢wdsÔΩ£: Project is running at http://0.0.0.0:8080/
‚Ñπ ÔΩ¢wdsÔΩ£: webpack output is served from http://localhost:8080/
‚Ñπ ÔΩ¢wdsÔΩ£: Content not from webpack is served from ./public-built/
(node:14486) DeprecationWarning: loaderUtils.parseQuery() received a non-string value which can be problematic, see https://github.com/webpack/loader-utils/issues/56
parseQuery() will be replaced with getOptions() in the next major version of loader-utils.
(Use `node --trace-deprecation ...` to show where the warning was created)
‚Ñπ ÔΩ¢wdmÔΩ£: Compiled with warnings.
‚Ñπ ÔΩ¢wdmÔΩ£: Compiling...

Error: modules/flowcharts/app/components/code-viewer-split.component.pug:108:1 - error NG5002: Unexpected character "EOF" (Do you have an unescaped "{" in your template? Use "{{ '{' }}") to escape it.)

108 
    

  modules/flowcharts/app/components/code-viewer-split.component.ts:17:16
    17   templateUrl: './code-viewer-split.component.pug',
                      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component CodeViewerSplitComponent.
modules/flowcharts/app/components/code-viewer-split.component.pug:35:19 - error NG5002: Invalid ICU message. Missing '}'.

35                 | {{ realTimeCollaborator.userInfo.displayName }}

..... <MORE_MESSAGES_HERE>

  modules/flowcharts/app/components/diagram-viewer.component.ts:91:16
    91   templateUrl: './diagram-viewer.component.pug',
                      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component DiagramViewerComponent.

‚Ñπ ÔΩ¢wdmÔΩ£: Compiled with warnings.
```
Then I go my dev page everything is perfect.

What is weird is that restarting webpack a few times usually gets rid of the error. The intermittent part is what puzzles me. To make the issue occur 100% of the times I can simply do:
```ts
new AngularCompilerPlugin({
    tsConfigPath: IS_PRODUCTION ? 'tsconfig.prod.json' : 'tsconfig.dev.json',
    entryModule: path.join(__dirname, 'src/app/app.module#AppModule'),
    forkTypeChecker: false,
    directTemplateLoading: true, # the errors above happen due to this!
  })
```

The workaround is to set `forkTypeChecker: false` and keep `directTemplateLoading: false`.

Therefore my conclusion is that something makes the forked type checker load templates directly. Any ideas how to debug it?

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
I haven't yet found standalone reproduction steps but I welcome any tips on how to debug it ...

## üî• Exception or Error
I pasted above. Looking for tips on how to capture the error in the code. Where to put console logs?

## üåç Your Environment
Not running CLI - just `@ngtools/webpack`
```
¬ª cat yarn.lock |grep ngtools/webpack
    "@ngtools/webpack" "11.0.1"
"@ngtools/webpack@11.0.1", "@ngtools/webpack@^11.0.1":
  resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/@ngtools/webpack/-/webpack-11.0.1.tgz#029aaff16d76fbfdf06422dde4c83f3b79c34215"
```

**Anything else relevant?**
It's occurring at least both on Linux and Mac
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 11: @ngtools/webpack : forkTypeChecker intermittently behaves as though directTemplateLoading is true" (#19407)

# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->

### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: ....

Yes and no. Depending which other lib I use forgot to update to a newer `symbol-observable` version.

### Description

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem...

This is something I get into more and more. One package depending on version x and the other on version y of the same lib. But this lib is not allowing different typed versions or in this case it is not even clear why different Observable approaches are used.

I have the following installed:

```
‚îú‚îÄ‚î¨ @angular/cli@11.0.1
‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ symbol-observable@2.0.3
‚îú‚îÄ‚î¨ @apollo/client@3.2.6
‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ symbol-observable@3.0.0
```

Running `serve` prints out:

```
ERROR in node_modules/symbol-observable/index.d.ts:6:14 - error TS2717: Subsequent property declarations must have the same type.  Property 'observable' must be of type 'symbol', but here has type 'unique symbol'.

6     readonly observable: unique symbol;
               ~~~~~~~~~~

  node_modules/rxjs/internal/symbol/observable.d.ts:4:18
    4         readonly observable: symbol;
                       ~~~~~~~~~~
    'observable' was also declared here.
```


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Share the link to the repo below along with step-by-step instructions to reproduce the problem, as well as expected and actual behavior.

Issues that don't have enough info and can't be reproduced will be closed.

You can read more about issue submission guidelines here: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#-submitting-an-issue
-->

Its hard to find where the problem come from, since the TypeScript nor Angular-CLI prints any line where that type issue come from.
So before I take that time to create a repl I would like to hear if this is an easy fix and if this `symbol-observable` is still needed because I thought RxJS provides such already.

## üî• Exception or Error

```
ERROR in node_modules/symbol-observable/index.d.ts:6:14 - error TS2717: Subsequent property declarations must have the same type.  Property 'observable' must be of type 'symbol', but here has type 'unique symbol'.

               ~~~~~~~~~~

    4         readonly observable: symbol;
                       ~~~~~~~~~~
    'observable' was also declared here.
```

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [x] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...

When running ng update on a 10.x project after angular 11 was released it is hard to do a partial update ie to the latest 10.x with @angular-devkit/build-angular since it's version numbers do not match the rest of angular at all. ie it uses `0.1000.5`.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

Bump @angular-devkit/build-angular versions up to 11.x so that they match the rest of the @angular/* repos or at least document this different versioning behavior on the `ng update` page.

You should be able to easily run `ng update @angular/core@^10 @angular-devkit/build-angular@10^` and get ie 10.2.x installed automatically when angular 11 was released.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

Perhaps better docs about this difference in versioning? ie links/info on the ng update page https://angular.io/cli/update

Ideally it'd just match the rest of angular so it isn't a special case as it's required on many projects.

Issues.Title: build: bump core-js from 2.6.10 to 3.7.0
Issues.Body:
Bumps [core-js](https://github.com/zloirock/core-js) from 2.6.10 to 3.7.0.
Changelog

Sourced from core-js's changelog.

3.7.0 - 2020.11.06
  • String#replaceAll moved to the stable ES, per June TC39 meeting
  • Promise.any and AggregateError moved to the stable ES, per July TC39 meeting
  • Added Reflect[@@toStringTag], per July TC39 meeting
  • Forced replacement of Array#{ reduce, reduceRight } in Chrome 80-82 because of a bug, #766
  • Following the changes in the upsert proposal, { Map, WeakMap }#emplace replace { Map, WeakMap }#upsert, these obsolete methods will be removed in the next major release
  • By the current spec, AggregateError#errors is own data property
  • Added correct iteration closing in the iteration helpers according to the current version of the proposal
  • process.nextTick have a less priority when Promise in the microtask implementation, #855
  • Fixed microtask implementation in engines with MutationObserver, but without document, #865, #866
  • Fixed core-js-builder with an empty (after the targets engines or another filtration) modules list, #822
  • Fixed possible twice call of window.onunhandledrejection, #760
  • Fixed some possible problems related multiple global copies of core-js, #880
  • Added a workaround for 3rd party Reflect.set polyfill bug, #847
  • Updated compat data:
    • Chrome up to 86
    • FF up to 82
    • Safari up to 14
  • Updated compat data mapping:
    • iOS up to 14
    • NodeJS up to 15.0
    • Electron up to 11.0
    • Samsung Internet up to 13.0
    • Opera Android up to 60
    • The rest automatically
  • Updated all required dependencies
3.6.5 - 2020.04.09
  • Updated Browserlist #755
  • Fixed setImmediate in Safari #770, thanks @dtinth
  • Fixed some regexp, thanks @scottarc
  • Added OPEN_SOURCE_CONTRIBUTOR detection in postinstall, thanks @scottarc
  • Added Drone CI in postinstall CI detection #781
3.6.4 - 2020.01.14
  • Prevented a possible almost infinite loop in non-standard implementations of some backward iteration array methods
3.6.3 - 2020.01.11
  • Fixed replacement of substitutes of undefined capture groups in .replace in Safari 13.0-, #471, #745, thanks @mattclough1
  • Improved compat data for old engines
3.6.2 - 2020.01.07
  • Fixed early implementations of Array#{ every, forEach, includes, indexOf, lastIndexOf, reduce, reduceRight, slice, some, splice } for the usage of ToLength
  • Added RegExp#exec dependency to methods which depends on the correctness of logic of this method (3.6.0-3.6.1 issue), #741
  • Refactored some internals
3.6.1 - 2019.12.25
  • Fixed a bug related Symbol with multiple copies of core-js (for 3.4.2-3.6.0), #736
  • Refactored some tools

... (truncated)

Issues.Title: fix(material/autocomplete): closing immediately when input is focused programmatically
Issues.Body:
Each autocomplete has a `click` listener on the body that closes the panel when the user has clicked somewhere outside of it. This breaks down if the panel is opened through a click outside of the form field, because we bind the listener before the event has bubbled all the way to the `body` so when it does get there, it closes immediately.

These changes fix the issue by taking advantage of the fact that focus usually moves on `mousedown` so for "real" click the input will have already lost focus by the time the `click` event happens.

Fixes #3106.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/autocomplete): closing immediately when input is focused programmatically" (#21081)

Issues.Title: build: ngOnChanges property access rule not working
Issues.Body:
Follow-up to #21074. We have a lint rule that flags property accesses like `changes.foo` where `changes` is a `SimpleChanges` object, because they'll break under Closure compiler. The rule depends on the TS type checker to identify the objects, but it seems like somewhere along the way, tslint changed how they construct the `Program` which removed the necessary type information.

These changes add a less complicated fallback which looks at whether the name of the receiver of a property access is the same as the name of the first method parameter.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: ngOnChanges property access rule not working" (#21075)

Issues.Title: Separate the datepicker validation and the picker constraint
Issues.Body:
Currently when we use the matDatePickerFilter to set the selectable dates for the datepicker, it automatically become the validator for the datepicker. However I believe there're valid use cases where picker selectable dates (constraints) don't necessarily equivalent to the validity of the datepicker value:
For example (see link below) I have a datepicker where at the moment of selection, user can only chose the dates from today forward, however it's possible that the current value of the datepicker is yesterday. This make the datepicker invalid even though it's considered valid. And the problem is there's no way to make the datepicker become valid for this case.
So I think that it's beneficial to be able to set the validation of the datepicker value independently from the picker filtering.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-datepicker-separation-of-picker-constraints?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdatepicker-overview-example.ts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Separate the datepicker validation and the picker constraint" (#21073)

Issues.Title: perf(cdk/testing): reduce change detections when running parallel actions
Issues.Body:
Switches all of our `testing` code to use `parallel` instead of `Promise.all` which reduces the number of change detections that we'll trigger during tests.

Also adds more type overloads to `parallel`, because the previous types didn't allow the `values` function to return mixed value arrays which we had in ~15 instances. I've tried to reduce the amount of code by only implementing up to 5 overloads, but we may want to expand it to 9 like `Promise.all`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(cdk/testing): reduce change detections when running parallel actions" (#21071)

Changelog

Sourced from gulp's changelog.

gulp changelog

4.0.0

Task system changes

  • replaced 3.x task system (orchestrator) with new task system (bach)
    • removed gulp.reset
    • removed 3 argument syntax for gulp.task
    • gulp.task should only be used when you will call the task with the CLI
    • added gulp.series and gulp.parallel methods for composing tasks. Everything must use these now.
    • added single argument syntax for gulp.task which allows a named function to be used as the name of the task and task function.
    • added gulp.tree method for retrieving the task tree. Pass { deep: true } for an archy compatible node list.
    • added gulp.registry for setting custom registries.

CLI changes

  • split CLI out into a module if you want to save bandwidth/disk space. you can install the gulp CLI using either npm install gulp -g or npm install gulp-cli -g, where gulp-cli is the smaller one (no module code included)
  • add --tasks-json flag to CLI to dump the whole tree out for other tools to consume
  • added --verify flag to check the dependencies in package.json against the plugin blacklist.

vinyl/vinyl-fs changes

  • added gulp.symlink which functions exactly like gulp.dest, but symlinks instead.
  • added dirMode param to gulp.dest and gulp.symlink which allows better control over the mode of the destination folder that is created.
  • globs passed to gulp.src will be evaluated in order, which means this is possible gulp.src(['*.js', '!b*.js', 'bad.js']) (exclude every JS file that starts with a b except bad.js)
  • performance for gulp.src has improved massively
    • gulp.src(['**/*', '!b.js']) will no longer eat CPU since negations happen during walking now
  • added since option to gulp.src which lets you only match files that have been modified since a certain date (for incremental builds)
  • fixed gulp.src not following symlinks
  • added overwrite option to gulp.dest which allows you to enable or disable overwriting of existing files

Issues.Title: bug(Scrolling): [Accessibility] - Virtual scroll viewport does not support keyboard interactions and is device dependent
Issues.Body:
**Reproduction**
https://stackblitz.com/angular/jbyrbregorl?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-virtual-scroll-overview-example.ts

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Navigate to the StackBlitz link provided above
2. Use any examples from the documentation for Scrolling CDK
3. Using keyboard interactions (Tab, Shift + Tab), verify whether the user can scroll the virtual scroll viewport (Issue)

**Expected Behavior:**
The <cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport> when displaying a large list of elements must be keyboard accessible. When using Tab, Shift + Tab, since there are interactive elements in the viewport, they need to be keyboard accessible. Any scrollable content that has interactive elements needs to receive explicit keyboard support by including them in the natural focus order(tabindex).

**Actual Behavior**
Currently the <cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport> is not keyboard accessible and is device dependent. Users need to use mouse to scroll through the contents in the viewport. Person with motor impairments who rely on keyboard/switch devices will not be able to access the elements inside the virtual scroll viewport. 

**Environment**
Angular: 10.2.7
CDK/Material: 10.2.7
Browser(s): all
Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): all

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71451445/99322248-943bdf80-283d-11eb-8726-a413c37749f9.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Scrolling): [Accessibility] - Virtual scroll viewport does not support keyboard interactions and is device dependent" (#21062)

Issues.Title: mat-form-field with appearance outline incorrectly recalculate outline-gap position if trigger Directionality change event.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/material2-mat-form-field-outline-rtl-issue-rzivqz?file=src/app/app.component.ts
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37027173/99304421-053dc000-285b-11eb-8ea1-2e8f716aae66.png)

 
Strange behavior, if we manually set dir=rtl for the document root - everything works fine, the outline-gap position is  recalculated correctly unless we trigger Directionality change event;

#### Environment

- Angular:  10.2.3
- CDK/Material: 10.2.7
- Browser(s): Chrome 86
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "mat-form-field with appearance outline incorrectly recalculate outline-gap position if trigger Directionality change event. " (#21061)

Issues.Title: refactor(material-experimental/mdc-core): remove underscores from imported mixins
Issues.Body:
* Removes the underscores from the names of mixins that are used in other files. This will become an error when we switch to the Sass module system.
* Renames some mixins that were starting with `mdc-` since they can be confused with mixins actually coming from MDC.
